questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibits.

Exhibit A -
//IMG//


Exhibit B -
//IMG//

Exhibit A shows the SD-WAN performance SLA configuration, the SD-WAN rule configuration, and the application IDs of Facebook and YouTube. Exhibit B shows the firewall policy configuration and the underlay zone status.
Based on the exhibits, which two statements are correct about the health and performance of port1 and port2? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Non-TCP Facebook and YouTube traffic are not used for performance measurement.
choices.C: FortiGate identifies the member as dead when there is no Facebook and YouTube traffic passing through the member.
choices.B: FortiGate is unable to measure jitter and packet loss on Facebook and YouTube traffic.
choices.A: The performance is an average of the metrics measured for Facebook and YouTube traffic passing through the member.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A,D are correct
Study Guide 7.0, pages 88 - 89.
Study Guide 7.2, pages 103 - 104.

Another comment said "because without using application Control on the firewall policy, SDWAN can't work" but there is a app control "default" defined on config.
A,D are correct

Selected Answer: AD
D is correct - SD-WAN_7.0_Study_Guide p.88

Selected Answer: AD
If B is correct it should include latency since it didn't mentioned the Latency therefore it indicates that latency is able to measure so the argument contradicts itself.

Selected Answer: AB
B because without using application Control" on the firewall policy, SDWAN can't work with Youtube an Facebook configured

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibits.

Exhibit A -
//IMG//


Exhibit B -
//IMG//

Exhibit A shows an SD-WAN event log and exhibit B shows the member status and the SD-WAN rule configuration.
Based on the exhibits, which two statements are correct? (Choose two.)

choices.A: FortiGate updated the outgoing interface list on the rule so it prefers port2.
choices.B: Port2 has the highest member priority.
choices.C: Port2 has a lower latency than port1.
choices.D: SD-WAN rule ID 1 is set to lowest cost (SLA) mode.

discussion.content: A, C are correct

Selected Answer: AC
A,C are correct

B is obvious incorrect
D is not correct, in cli it is using set mode priority = best quality 
so AC are correct

Selected Answer: AC
AC correct. Fortigate updates the priority member due to latency
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
study guide page 264, interface based

Answer A.
Interface-based shaping 
Interface-based shaping goes further, enabling traffic controls based on percentage of the interface bandwidth.

questions.question_text: Which best describes the SD-WAN traffic shaping mode that bases itself on a percentage of available bandwidth?

discussion.content: B,D are correct

Selected Answer: BD
B,D are correct

Selected Answer: BD
IPsec and GRE build based on underlay
B and D correct

Selected Answer: BD
IPSEC and GRE are overlay
LAG and Physical are underlay

questions.question_text: Which two interfaces are considered overlay links? (Choose two.)

Refer to the exhibits.

Exhibit A -
//IMG//


Exhibit B -
//IMG//

Exhibit A shows a site-to-site topology between two FortiGate devices: branch1_fgt and dc1_fgt. Exhibit B shows the system global and system settings configuration on dc1_fgt.
When branch1_client establishes a connection to dc1_host, the administrator observes that, on dc1_fgt, the reply traffic is routed over T_INET_0_0, even though T_INET_1_0 is the preferred member in the matching SD-WAN rule.
Based on the information shown in the exhibits, what configuration change must be made on dc1_fgt so dc1_fgt routes the reply traffic over T_INET_1_0?

discussion.content: A is correct

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/6.2.0/new-features/14295/controlling-return-path-with-auxiliary-session
What stdugy guide are you guys referring to?

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
Study Guide 7.0, pages 130 - 131
Study Guide 7.2, pages 156 - 157

Selected Answer: A
Correct answer is A. Study guide 7.0 page 130

Selected Answer: A
Controlling return path with auxiliary session
When multiple incoming or outgoing interfaces are used in ECMP or for load balancing, changes to routing, incoming, or return traffic interfaces impacts how an existing sessions handles the traffic. Auxiliary sessions can be used to handle these changes to traffic patterns.https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/7.0.11/administration-guide/14295/controlling-return-path-with-auxiliary-session
Sorry, I mean "B" is corretc. Page 139.
Answer A. To be the alternative "B" would have to disable the anti-replay
A is correct. Page 139 from study guide.

Answer A. 
as it will allow the replied traffic from dc1_fgt to be on T_INET_1_0 if that is the preferred member on dc1_fgt. traffic can continue to offload the asymmetric traffic because it matches the auxiliary session (reflect session)

choices.D: Disable allow-subnet-overlap under config system settings.
choices.A: Enable auxiliary-session under config system settings.
choices.B: Disable t—Åp-session-without-syn under config system settings.
choices.C: Enable snat-route-change under config system global.
